title: What are the advantages of using the internet over visiting a library? - Quora

response.answer_text: The internet is better when you’re looking for what we in libraries call “Ready Reference” which are answers to questions like: “What is the capital of China?” or “When was Shakespeare born?” If you also want to casually learn about a topic like the Napoleonic Wars, or evolutionary biology, the internet is super fast and has tons of information available. However, if the information you’re looking for is important, say its for business, school, health, or an important life decision, you really should come to the library. Librarians have a Masters Degree in research, and we can find the best information quickly.

All these reasons why it is better than a library are true. On the other hand, it is simultaneously much worse than a library because of the huge amount of irrelevant and misleading material, which you are just as likely to find with your search terms if you are not an experienced searcher.
